Package popt4jlib

popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AllChromosomeMakerIntf
    allows the definition of the neighborhood of a point in a search space that is needed by Local-Search algorithms in combinatorial optimization problems.
    Arg2ChromosomeMakerIntf
    interface defining the methods that an object must support so as to be able to convert a function argument (an object type that the function being minimized accepts) into a chromosome object (notion used in GA, SA, PS, EA meta-heuristics among others).
    Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf
    the inverse map of the Arg2ChromosomeMakerIntf.
    FunctionIntf
    interface defining a function mapping objects of some domain (not necessarily R^n) to R.
    NewChromosomeMakerIntf
    allows the creation of a new Object that will play the role of a chromosome in algorithms such as GA,EA,PS, etc.
    ObserverIntf
    This interface allows objects that want to be "monitoring" other "Subject" objects to be notified whenever a change in the subject occurs, and act accordingly.
    OptimizerIntf
    the interface every optimizer (for unconstrained optimization) must implement.
    PoolableObjectIntf
    interface specifies the contract for objects that can participate in thread-local object pools.
    RandomArgMakerClonableIntf  
    RandomArgMakerIntf
    interface class for constructing random arguments for a function.
    RandomChromosomeMakerIntf
    interface class for constructing random chromosome objects used in meta- heuristics such as GA,EA,PS,MC,SA etc.
    SparseVectorIntf
    this interface extends the standard VectorIntf in that it provides two methods to allow for (fast) loops over the non-zero elements of a sparse vector.
    SubjectIntf
    The SubjectIntf implements the Subject Object's methods in the well-known Observer Design Pattern.
    VecFunctionIntf
    definition of a vector function mapping vectors in R^n to vectors in R^m
    VectorIntf
    defines vectors in R^n
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Constants
    class defines compile-time constants useful in the methods of the classes in the parallel package, as well as in the Debug class in the utils package.
    DblArray1SparseVector
    sparse double[] implementation of VectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and a values array.
    DblArray1SparseVectorFE
    sparse double[] implementation of SparseVectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and the FULL length values array.
    DblArray1SparseVectorMT
    sparse double[] implementation of VectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and a values array.
    DblArray1Vector
    double[] implementation of VectorIntf.
    DblArray1VectorMaker
    class responsible for converting double[] chromosome objects into DblArray1Vector arguments for functions having as domain VectorIntf objects.
    DblArray1VectorThreadLocalPools
    auxiliary class using the ThreadLocal mechanism to create thread-local DblArray1Vector object pools.
    FltArray1SparseVector
    sparse float[] implementation of VectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and a values array.
    FunctionBase
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that keeps track of how many times a function has been evaluated.
    FunctionEvaluationTask
    auxiliary class used when the user requests function evaluations to be executed in separate threads in a thread-pool for a limited time so as to avoid "locking-up" the minimization process by function evaluations that take too long to complete (such evaluations are "lost" by the minimization process even if they eventually complete).
    IdentityArg2CMaker
    class implements the identity Arg->Chromosome transformation.
    IdentityC2ArgMaker
    class implements the identity Chromosome->Arg transformation.
    LimitedTimeEvalFunction
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that forces the function to execute in a different thread than the calling thread, allowing only up to a certain amount of time for execution.
    ReentrantFunctionBase
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that keeps track of how many times a function has been evaluated, plus it forces threads asking for function evaluation to execute sequentially.
    ReentrantFunctionBaseMT
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that keeps track of how many times a function has been evaluated, plus it forces threads asking for function evaluation to execute using a different FunctionIntf object, so that no calls from different threads execute on the same FunctionIntf object (this way, if the eval() call modifies only NON-static data members of the FunctionIntf object, there is no data race danger.)
    ReentrantSocketEvalFunctionBase
    The class is a wrapper for functions that are computed in a different process and communicate with the optimizer through sockets.
    ShiftedArgFunctionBase
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that evaluates the FunctionIntf object not on the actual VectorIntf or double[] argument x that it is given, but rather on a shifted vector x-δ, where the shift δ is passed in the params hashtable as a pair: <"function.shiftarg", double[] delta> However, if it is passed a non-vector of doubles argument, the eval() method simply passes along the argument to the underlying function without shifting it, since it does not know how to do the shifting.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    OptimizerException
    Exception class used by most optimization algorithms in the popt4jlib package to indicate abnormal execution of some task.

Package popt4jlib Description

popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.

Package Specification

A parallel (multi-threaded) version of a number of optimization algorithms and meta-heuristics for optimization in Java. The algorithms implemented include: Genetic Algorithms (island model), Simulated Annealing, Evolutionary Algorithms, Differential Evolution, Monte-Carlo (random) Search, Particle Swarm Optimization, Gradient-Descent methods including Steepest-Descent and Conjugate-Gradient, and several graph-optimization algorithms including Shortest-Path problems, Weighted Clique problems, Minimum Spanning Tree problems etc.
